data.title: Arizona Animal Wellness Center
data.meta_description: Arizona Animal Wellness Center is a full service family-owned veterinary practice. Meet the team that is committed to providing the best veterinary care for your pet in the Gilbert area.
data.text:
Dr. Parva is passionate about leading our organization and positively impacting the lives of others. She is a graduate of the University of Arizona and Colorado State University and has practiced in the valley since 1997. Her superpower is upholding the standards and principles of AAHA to ensure we are providing the exceptional care all of our patients deserve. She is an avid book “collector” and has three worn copies of The Hitchhiker’s Guide to the Universe, all of which are only partially read. Dr. Parva is also known as “Queen B” and ensures our Rockstar team has lots of snacks in our breakroom to keep us all fed. On the weekends, you can find her cheering on her daughter in a myriad of sports endeavors and supporting her love of Pokemon battles.

Dr. Parva is a Fear Free Certified Professional.

Dr. Ford is certified in Companion Animal Rehabilitation and one of the owners of Arizona Animal Wellness Center. She is a rare breed in that she is a true Arizona native, which means she needs very little water to survive. She received her DVM degree from Colorado State University in 1997 and could not wait to return to the warmth of the desert to be a Veterinarian. Dr. Ford integrates both traditional western medicine as well as alternative medicine to achieve the best outcome for her patients. She can often be found practicing yoga in the warmest areas of her home, as well as digging in her garden with her daughter and hiking the San Tan Mountains.

(Please note that Dr Ford is not currently taking new patients).

Dr. Ford is a Fear Free Certified Professional.

Dr. Tedrow is originally from the Pacific Northwest. He attended Washington State University and graduated in 1972 with a degree in Biological Sciences and then a degree in Doctor of Veterinary Medicine in 1975 (not a misprint - he is the oldest and baldest veterinarian at AAWC). After owning and operating a large and small animal practice for more than 25 years in Washington and Idaho, he has focused on staying current, competent, and compassionate in small animal medicine, which is no easy task with the advancements being made every day in veterinary medicine. Dr. Tedrow, his wife Suzanne, and their dog Olive have thoroughly embraced all of the sunshine and outdoor activities that Arizona can provide. In the summer months, they escape as much as possible to their second home in Pinetop to reconnect with the lakes and pine trees in the White Mountains.

Dr. Colton is a native Californian and earned a B.S. in Animal Science in 1983 from UC Davis. After graduation, he worked for three years in the dairy industry in upstate New York as a field nutritionist for the Pillsbury Company. He received his DVM in 1990 from Oklahoma State University and has practiced at Central Oregon Animal Hospital as both an employee and owner since graduation. Dr.Colton has dedicated his career to gaining expertise in the treatment of orthopedic diseases. His practice emphasizes advanced surgical care and he has received the following training and certificates:

Ohio State/ AO-North America Basic and Masters Orthopedic Training

Cruciate Ligament Repair

Advanced training in multiple techniques of cruciate ligament repair including; TPLO, TTA, CBLO, Tightrope and Isolock

Fracture Repair

Advanced training in both external fixation and locking plate systems for complex fractures in large breeds, toy breeds, and cats.

Patellar Luxation

Advanced training in both diagnosis and corrective treatment of various causes of patellar luxation

Growth Deformities

Advanced training in Osteotomies for corrective limb alignment

Elbow Dysplasia

Trained in the P.A.U.L technique for treatment of Elbow Dysplasia

PennHip- Hip evaluation certification

VetStem- Stem Cell Therapy Certification

Assistant Instructor for Intrauma Veterinary Orthopedics

Attending Veterinarian at the High Desert Museum from 2014-2016

Dr.Colton continues making advanced surgical treatments his priority in providing personalized care in a friendly, compassionate, and comfortable environment.

David's interests include fly fishing, backpacking, woodworking, and traveling with his wife Sylvia and their three dogs.

Dr. Hansen is an Arizona native of the west valley. She received her bachelor of science degree in biology at Northern Arizona University, where she quickly learned the cold was not for her. She went to experience warmer weather at Louisiana State University, where she attended vet school. Dr. Hansen returned to her roots in Arizona to practice before joining the team. Dr. Hansen has an interest in feline medicine and is an avid cat owner with three special kitties of her own. In her spare time out of the office, she enjoys playing video games and spending time with family and friends.

Dr. Hansen is a Fear Free Certified Professional.

Dr. Franca hails from San Paulo, Brazil and graduated from the University of San Paulo with his Veterinary Degree. Dr. Franca started his career working in wildlife and zoo medicine to include a myriad of species such as birds of prey, monkeys, large cats, reptiles, and anteaters, in addition to his love for dogs and cats. Dr. Franca is passionate about leadership and ensuring the safety of patient care in both critically ill patients as well as those undergoing anesthesia and hospitalization. His areas of interest in veterinary medicine include clinical medical cases, and utilizes Fear-Free and Cat-Friendly methods of care. In his spare time, he enjoys wildlife photography, hiking and has an interest in bladesmithing - suffice it to say, there is never a "dull" moment around Dr. Franca!

Dr. Franca is an AAFP-Certified Cat Friendly Professional.

Dr. Franca is a Fear Free Certified Professional.

Dr. Carolina Rossi is originally from São Paulo, Brazil.

She attended vet school at the University of São Paulo, and graduated in 2002. In 2004 she moved to the United States with her husband. They have a daughter, and a mini zoo at home: 3 dogs, 2 cats, 2 snakes, a box turtle, a bearded dragon, and 4 guinea pigs. In her spare time she enjoys going out with her family and friends, spending time with her pets, hiking, cooking, and traveling.

Dr Rossi enjoys practicing all aspects of Veterinary Medicine, nothing makes her happier than making our animal companions healthy!

Dr Rossi is a Fear Free Certified Professional.

Dr Schroeder was born and raised in Barrington, Illinois. She did her undergraduate degree at Hope College in Holland, Michigan. Following college Dr Schroeder lived in Indianapolis, Indiana and worked in the cancer research division of Riley Children's Hospital prior to veterinary school. She attended Veterinary school at the University of Illinois College of Veterinary Medicine in Champaign/Urbana. After one too many cold winters, Dr. Schroeder moved to Phoenix and practiced in North Central Phoenix at East Maryland Animal Hospital for 23 years before deciding to join the AAWC team. Dr. Schroeder is very excited to join the AAWC team and help contribute to their high standards of care. Her areas of interests include canine and feline internal medicine, preventative care and senior care. In her spare time she enjoys cooking, traveling and spending time with her family and friends.

Dr. Schroeder is a Fear Free Certified Professional.

Dr Stone grew up in Tucson, AZ. As far back as she can remember she wanted to be a veterinarian. In an effort to make that dream come true, she moved to Ft Collins, Colorado right after high school graduation to attend Colorado State University. She graduated with her Bachelor’s in Animal Science, Masters in Biomedical Science and with her Doctor of Veterinary Medicine in 2009.

Dr Stone originally planned on practicing large animal medicine but life had other plans. She found herself in a small animal practice and couldn’t be happier. Dr Stone loves the relationships she builds with clients and their pets! She has a special love for surgery and says “There is no greater feeling than to bring a pet to their owner, who didn’t know if they would see them again!"

She currently lives in Ft Collins, CO with her husband Will and their two daughters, Ayslee and Ahmee.

Dr Stone loves AAWC and comes to help out whenever her schedule allows.

Adam has been part of the team at Arizona Animal Wellness Center since 2006.

He is a native of Arizona, and while he did spend some of his childhood in Colorado, he spent most of his later childhood years in Parker, AZ. Adam started his career in veterinary medicine at the age of fourteen working with his grandfather who was a veterinarian going on farm calls. At the age of seventeen he worked as a veterinary technician at his uncle’s veterinary practice. Adam has had the opportunity to mentor and work alongside numerous great veterinarians but has ultimately decided to call Arizona Animal Wellness Center his home. Adam is an avid outdoors-man and enjoys mountain biking, camping, hiking, and spending time with his family. He and his wife have a son along with two Sphynx cats and two dogs. Adam aspires to continue his career in veterinary medicine by assisting in the growth and development of his peers and teammates to create not only an exceptional place to work but an extraordinary place to bring your pets and family members.

Adam is a Fear Free Certified Professional.

In 2001, Jennifer embarked on her journey in the veterinary field fueled by a passion for wildlife. Although her initial aspiration was to become a wildlife vet, her experience in the industry led her to discover that vet school wasn't the right fit. Nonetheless, her dedication to animal welfare never wavered, and she found fulfillment in caring for animals of all ages, from infancy to their golden years.

Jennifer holds a Bachelor of Science degree from ASU, specializing in Wildlife Habitat Management, and an MBA from the University of Phoenix, focusing on Human Resources Management. This unique blend of academic background equips her with a diverse skill set to excel in her role.

In her personal life, Jennifer shares a deep connection with her high school sweetheart, with whom she has spent 26 years together, celebrating 17 years of marriage. Their family includes a son and three cherished dogs. Sparkle, their energetic 7-year-old lab/boxer/pit mix, brings joy and liveliness to their home, along with her younger sister, Rosie. The family recently welcomed Yogurt, a loving addition adopted from Love Connection, who keeps the household bustling with activity.

When she's not caring for her family or furry companions, Jennifer enjoys cozy movie nights, where she engages in spirited movie line competitions with her husband. Her decision to join the AAWC team as a rockstar reflects her commitment to team building and delivering exceptional customer service, embodying her dedication to making a positive impact in both her professional and personal life.

Jennifer is a Level 2 Fear Free Certified Professional.

Jackie has been a part of the veterinary industry for over ten years and joined Arizona Animal Wellness Center in 2022. She graduated from the University of Illinois with a degree in Animal Science and Biotechnology. She is originally from the Midwest and moved to Arizona at the end of 2019 for the warm weather and sunshine. Jackie loves spending time outside and traveling. Her current travel goal is to visit all 50 states. She has two cats named Layla and Castiel and two dogs, Waffles and Winnie. She chooses to be a member of the AAWC to help build the team and ensure all clients and patients are receiving the best quality of care.

Jackie is a Fear Free Certified Professional.

Rob grew up in the Cincinnati area, home to the Big Red Machine, and comes to us in semi-retirement from 40 years of corporate finance. He earned his MBA in Finance from Tulane University and has spent his diverse career in Finance, Accounting, Information Systems, and Manufacturing. Rob is a true blue cat person having raised kitties all his life, including the two current ragdolls - Bandit & Minka. As a hobby, Rob writes a blog about growing up in the Cincinnati area in the 60s and 70s and has over 250 real-life stories. Rob has been married to his high school sweetheart for 43 years and has raised 3 boys. He moved around the country for work and decided to settle in Arizona where he and his wife enjoy many hours of golf, hiking, and biking.

Samantha has been in the veterinary field for over 25 years. She was going to school to be a veterinarian but once she got into the field she realized being a technician was much more fulfilling. She got her CVT and is so blessed to have a career that she is passionate about. She has 2 dogs a rotti-hound cross and a chihuahua who runs the show. She has been with her husband Mike for 30 years and have 2 grown daughters, 1 grandson, and a granddaughter on the way. Outside of work she is very active in her church and community.

Samantha is a Fear Free Certified Professional.

Michelle has been a part of the AAWC family since 2015. Though Michelle began as a veterinary technician, she has fulfilled several roles within our team, and most recently has taken on the task of marketing and social media.

During the pandemic, she was one of the many employees that assisted operations from home to keep the hospital and communications running as smoothly as possible.

She has always had a passion for animals and was naturally drawn to working in the veterinary field. After deciding in 2006 to attend school as Veterinary Assistant, she began working as a technician shortly after. While working full-time, she graduated with an Associate's Degree in Medical Office Management in 2007. Michelle has 4 adult children & her four-legged hoard includes Molly, a black golden mix, Levi Ryder, a golden retreiver; 5 cats, Baby, Domino, Sunny, Kisses, and the newest, Mizu; 1 Bearded Dragon, Ruby; 2 Rosy Bourke Parakeets, Romeo & Juliet. She & her family enjoy traveling, rock-hounding, chasing desert storms, and having fun conversations with people & each other.

Michelle is a Fear Free Certified Professional.

Stacey has been with AAWC since 2019. What started as a client-patient relationship blossomed into a passion to be a part of the elite team at the top-tier veterinary hospital.

For Stacey, compassion extends not only to the adorable pets but also to the pet parents who entrust their beloved companions to AAWC's care. Every day, she puts her heart and soul into ensuring that each pet receives the utmost love and attention.

Hailing from the sunny Southern California region, Stacey has a natural affinity for beach vibes. When not at the clinic, you'll find her basking in the sun with a good book in hand, losing herself in the pages of a captivating story.

Disneyland holds a special place in her heart, having been her second home. The magical world of Disney has always been a source of joy and inspiration for her.

Indulging in retail therapy is one of her favorite pastimes. She loves to shop and believes in treating herself to the finer things in life. Manicures, pedicures, facials, and massages are not just luxuries for her but moments of zen and self-pampering.

Christmas is not just a holiday; it's Stacey's favorite time of the year. The festive spirit, twinkling lights, and the joy of giving make it extra special.

In Stacey's world, family is everything. Her husband, a Bay Area native, and their two energetic Mini Aussies, along with the sassy flame point Siamese named Savvy, complete her world. Together, they form a loving and vibrant family that mirrors the compassion and care she brings to the AAWC family.

Stacey is a Level 2 Fear Free Certified Professional.

Originally hailing from Southern California, Linda has been an Arizona resident for over six years. In 2017, her longtime passion for animals inspired her to join Arizona Animal Wellness Center, where she's dedicated her time as a Client Patient Technician adapting to the inner workings of the veterinarian industry. Utilizing her 20+ years of past experience in client relations, she excels in maintaining effective communication between the clinic and its various clients, ensuring that both pets and their owners receive the highest level of care and service.

Beyond her professional responsibilities, Linda has a fondness for wine tasting, mastering her culinary skills, collecting old cookbooks, & reading crime fiction novels. She's been married for over 27 years, & cares deeply for her husband, young adult son, & Chocolate Labrador named, Kuma.

Allie is from Buffalo, NY, and moved to Arizona almost 7 years ago. She is a proud pet mom to 2 pitbull boys, a cat, 2 turtles, and her bearded dragon. She is new to the veterinary field as a CSR at AAWC and couldn't be happier to be a part of the AAWC family. Her favorite part of the veterinary field is being able to help decrease stress for pets in our clinic. In her free time, she enjoys cooking, and hanging out with her variety of animals.

Allie is a Fear Free Certified Professional.

Bri found her calling at AAWC after an extensive exploration of the clinic’s webpage. Intrigued by the clinic’s values, she was particularly drawn to the “Our Why” and “Our Standard of Excellence” sections cementing her decision to join the team in 2020.

For Bri, the most fulfilling aspects of her job revolve around client/patient care and the collaborative spirit within the team. She takes pride in contributing to a standard of excellence that aligns with her values and beliefs.

Beyond the clinic walls, Bri’s heart belongs to her family and loyal companion, Keeya, a spirited lab retriever mix. In her free time, she immerses herself in the tranquility of nature, finding solace in hiking adventures. A true food enthusiast, she delights in exploring new culinary delights with her family, adding a flavorful touch to her life outside of work.

Briana is a Fear Free Certified Professional.

Gina, joined our team in July of 2020 with a vision of finding a new “home” after embarking on a career transition in 2020. Drawn by the allure of our state-of-the-art facility, Gina began her journey at AAWC as a Customer Service Representative (CSR) and has since risen to the role of Shift Lead. In her current role, Gina serves as a steadfast support pillar for her CSR team and contributes significantly to the overall success of AAWC. Recognized as the voice of her team, Gina embodies the spirit of authentic leadership, a quality that aligns seamlessly with one of AAWC’s core values–authenticity. She values transparency and believes in keeping it real in every aspect of her work. Gina’s innate passion for helping others has been a driving force throughout her career, making her role at AAWC exceptionally fulfilling. Born a natural helper, she thrives on providing support and guidance to the team and the organization as a whole. Beyond the walls of AAWC, Gina’s life is enriched by her family, particularly her grandchildren, with whom she loves spending quality time. Her canine companion, Hank, a charming pittie mix, adds joy and warmth to her life. Outside of her familial pursuits, Gina finds solace in nature, often retreating to her cabin and exploring the serenity of the woods. Prior to joining AAWC, Gina’s diverse professional journey included a decade-long tenure as a Pre-K teacher, showcasing her commitment to education and nurturing young minds. Before that, she demonstrated her versatility as a bartender, mastering the art of hospitality. Gina’s journey at AAWC reflects her dedication, authenticity, and unwavering commitment to making a positive impact both within the organization and in the lives of those she serves.

Gina is a Fear Free Certified Professional.

After working in the NASCAR industry for over 8 years Nikki wanted a change and her love for animals brought her into the veterinary field. She started her veterinary career in 2010 in a small family-owned veterinary clinic in Charlotte, NC. She relocated to Arizona in January 2012 to be closer to her family and started her career at AAWC in May of 2012. She is a mom of 2 crazy two legged boys and one four legged fur daughter, Cooper. She strives to make a difference each day for AAWC's clients and their pets. She's called AAWC home since 2012 and cannot imagine working anywhere else.

Nikki is a Fear Free Certified Professional.

Born and raised in California, Georgeanne moved to Arizona with her husband and two children in 1997. Her career in the veterinary field did not become a reality until, in her Senior year at USC, she followed her strong interest in working with dogs. She took dog training courses, became certified, all a product of doing research for a Career Development course. Since then she has never looked back.

In 1979 she began her career in the field by starting as a Veterinary Assistant. Over the years, she widened her scope by serving as a receptionist (now known as a CSR), which led to her being actively involved in training and management.

She began her life with AAWC 6 months into its opening its doors. With a bit of hiatus, she came back to her passion for serving the pets and families that AAWC continues to care for.

Her home life is an extension of her work life, in that her husband is a Veterinary Technician. Her daughter was also in the field for many years. She and her husband will never be ‘empty nesters’. They have Arlo, a Pitbull mix, and three cats (Gray Boy, Stitch, and Mindy). But they have had many 4-legged kids that they have been blessed to have in their lives. Their 2-legged kids are now grown and have kids of their own, so Georgeanne and her husband keep busy with having 4 of their grandkids close by. She is proud to be part of AAWC’s family all these years.

Brittany was intrigued by our hospital's prestigious AAHA accreditation and its commitment to cleanliness, Brittany joined our team in 2021 with a shared dedication to providing exceptional pet care.

In her role, Brittany finds the most fulfillment in assisting pet parents during emergencies, showcasing her compassion and commitment to the well-being of our furry friends. Whether providing support over the phone or in the clinic, she approaches each situation with empathy and a steadfast commitment to excellence.

At the core of Brittany’s professional values are a strong work ethic, unwavering integrity, and loyalty to both her colleagues and the animals in our care. Beyond the clinic, Brittany shares her life with a delightful mini poodle mix, enriching her days with the joy and companionship that pets bring. During her downtime, she indulges in the simple pleasures of reading and taking leisurely walks with her four-legged companion. Brittany’s dedication to our mission, coupled with her love for animals, makes her an invaluable member of the AAWC team.

Brittany is a Fear Free Certified Professional.

Erin grew up in Maryland in a house full of cats and discovered her love for all animals at an early age. She graduated from The University of Maryland with a BS degree in Natural Resource Management Plant and Wildlife, where she spent two years as a Wildlife Biologist doing clinical research. Erin quickly realized her true passion was veterinary medicine. She has worked in general practice for over 28 years as a Certified Veterinary Technician, Client Relations Specialist, and Hospital Manager. Erin currently resides in Chandler with her husband of 20 years, 2 Labrador Retrievers, Moose and River, and a very spoiled cat Maggie. She spends her free time hiking, camping, and fishing.

Erin is a Fear Free Certified Professional.

Born and raised in Illinois, Ashley has just recently moved to Arizona. She was previously going to school to become a fire fighter/paramadic and ending up falling in love with animal medicine. That was one of the best decsions made, and she has been in the field for 10 plus years. She currently has 2 dogs, Peaches a terrior mix, Odie an anatolion mix and Boo her chincilla. In her free time she like to spend time with her husband, enjoying the outdoors and hiking.

Ashley is a Fear Free Certified Professional.

Jessica has worked in the industry since 2004, doing everything from kennel, assistant, CSR, technician, technician supervisor, pharmacy technician to pharmacy manager. She graduated from Michigan State University in 2009 with her Bachelor's Degree in Veterinary Technology. She never would have thought back then that she would ultimately be doing anything but hands-on patient care, but the very first day she worked in the pharmacy department she knew she would stay! She has a passion for anything pharmacology or laboratory-related, especially microscope work, and learning more every day about different lab values, cells, microbes, etc., how they work, and what they mean to our patients to help us be able to ultimately better treat them. Outside of work, she and her husband enjoy spending every second they can with their sons. They love traveling, especially abroad & also love going to a cycle class at the gym and going to concerts. They have 2 super loveable cats at home – Bandit, and Jigsy – Truett loves them to pieces, but sometimes a little more than they would like.

Jessica is a Fear Free Certified Professional.

Tricia has lived in Arizona all her life making her a true Arizonan through and through. She grew up in Gilbert and currently resides in Queen Creek with her husband (her high school sweet heart) and their 2 children. She had always harbored a strong desire to work with animals from a very young age. Those ambitions led to the start of her work in the veterinary field in 2004. She has worn many hats since then - from a vet tech, to a customer service/patient advocate, to now as a Pharmacy and Lab Assistant Manager. She feels very fortunate to have found her passion and area of expertise working in the pharmacy/lab here at AAWC. Outside of work she relishes in the great outdoors, and one of her favorite past times is camping and traveling with her family. She also enjoys making memories with her kids, working out and engaging in a healthy lifestyle for both herself and her family.

Tricia is a Fear Free Certified Professional.

Nykala has been in the veterinary field for many years, volunteering at shelters and then coming to AAWC in 2015. She worked her way up from animal care assistant to Pharmacy and Lab Assistant Manager. She has always loved animals and wanted to find ways that she could best help them and be there for them. She is currently in the process of obtaining her veterinary technician license. Her family consists of her parents, 4 brothers, and seriously an entire zoo (cats, dogs, birds, hedgehog, etc.) in her house, but she wouldn’t have it any other way! She enjoys taking care of the stray animals that come in, attempting to find their homes and/or adopt them out if need be! Her specialty is tiny orphaned kittens and she absolutely loves raising them and being their momma!

Nykala is a Level 3 Fear Free Certified Professional.

Bianca came to the veterinary field because she felt it would be the most challenging and rewarding job she ever had, and she was right. She's always loved animals and felt the most fulfillment in her life caring for them. Aside from working in veterinary clinics she's spent many years fostering kittens when able and worked in a pharmacy specializing in veterinary medicine. Bianca came to AAWC in 2019; she splits her time between the pharmacy/lab and helping as a technician. She currently has 3 cats (Pixie, Wednesday, and Pippy) and 2 dogs (Salem- a German Shepard, and Billy- a chihuahua) Outside of work she loves going to the movies, reading, and spending time up north (Sedona & Flagstaff).

Bianca is a Fear Free Certified Professional.

Desirea was born in Arizona, but spent her childhood moving a lot and has lived in seven different states. She started her career in the veterinary field in 2008 in a small town in Kansas initially as a technician assistant. She has always had a soft spot for animals since a child, especially cats. Joining the AAWC team in 2020, she enjoys working with an amazing team with a passion for animals. Desirea is currently in progress to become a fear-free certified team member. She currently has an "only child" fur baby, Duey the cat, who insists on keeping it that way. Desirea is married and has three grown stepsons and three grandchildren. She is very active in her church and enjoys the outdoors. Any spare time is spent hiking and she loves camping and racing quads with her husband.

Amber has been a part of the AAWC Team since March of 2021. She graduated from ASU with a Bachelor of Science in biology focusing on pre-veterinary medicine in the Spring of 2022. In her free time, she spends time with her cat Persephone and she loves to read. She also has a passion for music. She has been singing since a young child and plays the piano. Animals always brighten her days, and she is excited to learn more here at AAWC.

Amber is a Fear Free Certified Professional.

Natalie has been a part of the AAWC family since 2014.

She started working at AAWC because of the love she has for animals! She has a pit bull mix, Opie, a rescue pit, Uma, and a cat, Jojo. She and her husband have one amazing daughter who everyone at AAWC adores! Any chance she gets she is with her family! Her passion is integrative medicine and she is a Certified Cannabis Counselor. She hopes to one day be a canine massage therapist and rehabilitation technician.

Natalie is a Fear Free Certified Professional.

Jenna has been a part of the AAWC family since 2019. As a Lead Technician, Jenna helps the team with direction and providing an extra hand when needed. She has had a soft spot for animals all her life. She graduated Pima with her Associates in Veterinary Technology.

She has been with her husband since high school and welcomed a daughter in 2020. They also have two shih tzus named Pickles and Gambit. They have one cat named Kitty.

In her spare time her love for anything to do with water like swimming or going to the lake or river are her favorites. She enjoys spending time with her family, reading, and making the team laugh.

Jenna is a Fear Free Certified Professional.

Noah developed a fascination with veterinary medicine at the age of 14 when he had to take his pet python to the vet and was sent home with injections and fluids to give. By his late teens he was working full time in an animal hospital (or two) while attending the medical assistant program at community college and later attending Professional Veterinary Assistant School. Since then Noah has held technician positions in veterinary hospitals ranging from general practice to emergency/critical care, avian/exotic and specialty internal medicine. Noah has always had a hunger and passion for learning and serving the community through providing the highest quality of medical care their pets can be offered. When not at work, Noah enjoys spending time with his beautiful wife and kids, BBQing, horticulture/gardening, caring for his collection of reptiles and doing DIY projects at home or tinkering in the garage. During the monsoon season Noah is in hot pursuit of finding and photographing native species of reptiles, amphibians and other wildlife in the mountains and deserts. Some of Noah’s clinical special interests include anesthesia, pain control and surgical assistance.

Noah is a Fear Free Certified Professional.

Sabrina has always had a huge heart for animals since she was really little. It sure shows since she has been in the veterinary field for 16 years and became certified in January of 2022. Her passion is being involved in the surgery department, which is something she is really good at! Always wanting to learn something new and helping others. A goal in the near future is to become an anesthesiologist. During her spare time, she enjoys anything that involves the outdoors, scrapbooking/arts and crafts with family, winter sports, water sports, reading, volunteering, and traveling.

Sabrina is a Fear Free Certified Professional.

Katie started at AAWC as an animal care assistant in 2015 while still attending college at Pima Medical Institute's Veterinary Technician program. Growing up, she always knew she wanted to do something with animals. When she was little, she volunteered at the pound with her mom feeding the cats and dogs and learned about bottle feeding baby kittens. Since then, she rarely passes up the opportunity to help with the bottle babies that come into the clinic. Her son, Ben, also enjoys fostering the little ones and he calls himself “The Cat Man!” Katie has 4 dogs named Roxy, Lucy, Dante, and Bluey. She also has 4 cats named Bolt, Belle, Sassy and Chance, as well as my 2 hairless guinea pigs (skinny pigs) named Max and Eleven. When Katie is not working you can find her hiking, going to the gym, or just hanging out at home with her family.

Katie is a Level 3 Fear Free Certified Professional.

Chelsea has been in the veterinary industry since 2005. She started as a receptionist and became a Certified Veterinary Technician in 2010. Chelsea has been with Arizona Animal Wellness Center since 2011. Her level of detail and passion for excellence in veterinary care is unsurpassed. We are proud of her growth in the field of veterinary medicine and grateful for the difference she makes in the lives of others. In Chelsea's free time, she enjoys baking, spending time with her son and her hilarious four-legged family members, Einstein, Sullivan, and....the party chickens have recently invited a few party ducks!

Chelsea is a Fear Free Certified Professional.

Joey is a native Arizonan and has always felt a special bond with animals, starting from a young age. After spending over 20 years as a manager in the commercial and retail paint industry, he returned to school to pursue a career in veterinary medicine and graduated from the Veterinary Technology program at Mesa Community College in 2017. Joey started his second career in emergency veterinary medicine before joining AAWC in 2019. He has a passion for helping people, advocating for animals, and leading by example. Joey is married to his best friend, Kristine, and lives in San Tan Valley with their dog, Leilani, and two cats, Littles and Bond. He is happy to be serving the community of AAWC.

Joey is a Level 3 Fear Free Certified Professional.

Jamie joined AAWC in April 2019. After a decade of working in higher education as an academic advisor, she realized her true calling was leading her down a different path. Inspired by her love of animals and her personal experiences with her pets, Jamie returned to school to complete her Associate of Applied Science in Veterinary Technology. Jamie graduated from Mesa Community College in May 2019 and received her certification later that summer.

Jamie was a client of AAWC years before entering the field and knew that this was the only place she wanted to be. Jamie is grateful to be part of the AAWC team and promises to love and care for each pet that she sees as if they were her own. When not at the clinic, Jamie enjoys spending time with her husband and her rescue kids; three Boxers and a kitty. Jamie is passionate about pet nutrition and integrative medicine. Jamie and her husband have a deep love for the Boxer breed and have fostered over a dozen rescue boxers over the years, including three hospice pets.

Jamie is a Fear Free Certified Professional.

Choosing the veterinary field was easy for Arielle. Since she was little she always had a love for animals both big and small. It only made sense to pursue her career and devote her life to helping save animals. Going to tech school was the best decision she ever made! Arielle was born and raised in Arizona with her grandparents and sister. Most of her family is from New York and New Jersey so you could say she's a little ways from home. She has a wide variety of animals at home. She has 2 dogs, 5 cats, 3 leopard geckos, and a guinea pig. They definitely keep her very busy! Some of her hobbies include photography, horseback riding, and playing guitar.

Arielle is a Fear Free Certified Professional.

As a little girl in Oklahoma, Dee would frequently visit her grandfather's rabbitry (rabbit farm) where she fell in love with animals and veterinary medicine. Dee has been a veterinary technician since 2009. She has an interest in animal behavior and training. Dee is the founder of our Kitten Specialist Team- taking in neonatal kittens, bottle feeding, and raising them until adoption. In her free time Dee likes to read (she loves Harry Potter), travel, and spend time with her 3 dogs and 3 cats. She loves being outdoors, fishing, hiking, stand-up paddle boarding, and camping with her husband, step-daughter, and son.

In 2017 she began her journey in Fear Free to help pets become less anxious in the clinic.

Dee is an Elite Level Fear Free Professional and is also a Fear Free Certified Animal Trainer.

Raquel was born and raised in São Paulo, Brazil, and has lived in Arizona since 2018. She met her husband during a trip to the USA in 2016 and they spent the next 2 years traveling between the US and Brazil. As a lover of the desert, when she first came to Arizona, she knew it would be her home one day. She has always loved animals and working with them is a big part of her life. She graduated from a school of veterinary medicine in São Paulo in 2009 and worked as a veterinarian until she moved to the USA. Her dream is to validate her degree in the United States and be able to continue her profession here. Working as a Technician at AAWC has been extremely important to her and she is grateful to be able to continue in the veterinary field and learn with other amazing professionals. She loves spending time with her husband, their dog Pita (a 6 yo Karelian Bear dog), and their cat Rado (a 1 yo cat that her husband found under the house where he worked). One of her big passions is traveling. She loves visiting different spots & cultures as well as trying new foods and meeting new people.

Raquel is a Level 3 Fear Free Certified Professional.

Kayla is a magnet for learning new things and jumps at any opportunity to grow her skills as a veterinary technician. She embodies AAWC's core value of "Service" like a Rockstar with an attention to detail and love. She has a knack for training new team members. Her talent for cleaning pet's ears is unsurpassed and does it with the utmost gentleness and care for our furry patients. On her off time, Kayla loves to recharge her batteries by playing video games and watching movies. She collects antique perfume bottles as a budding alchemist. Mary Shelly's Frankenstein is her favorite movie and she dreams of traveling to Germany to visit the birthplace of the inspiration for one of the most famous monsters of all time.

Kayla is a Fear Free Certified Professional.

Lindsey started her career in this field because animals don't get all the love that they deserve so working with them daily will help ensure that she can help take care of them. Her current goals are to graduate from CGCC with her associate's degree with a future goal to go to school and become a Veterinarian. One day she would like to own a practice as well as an animal sanctuary to rescue large and small animals from horrific conditions. In her spare time, she enjoys going on road trips and camping with her dogs or anything that involves her dogs.

Lindsey is a Fear Free Certified Professional.

Teresa has been with us since early 2024.

Teresa's coffee addiction is rivaled only by her love for animals and her ambition to grow in the veterinary field. She's on a quest to become fear-free certified, aiming to make every pet's visit to the clinic as enjoyable as a belly rub. Her thirst for knowledge doesn't stop there; she dreams of furthering her education in veterinary medicine, fueled by an insatiable curiosity and probably a fair amount of caffeine. Every day is a new adventure, filled with learning opportunities and the occasional surprise—like finding out how many treats it takes to convince Bo and Olivia to vacate her spot on the couch. Teresa believes in laughter, the power of a good book, and the magic of a well-timed coffee break. She's determined to leave a paw print on the hearts of all the pets she meets and maybe, just maybe, learn how to make the perfect latte along the way.

Teresa has been playing tag with the veterinary field since she was 16, ducking in and out but always getting caught by her love for animals. She's the proud human of a Vizsla named Bo and a Frenchie named Olivia, who are the reigning champions of the "Best Couch Potatoes" in her household. When not at work, she can be found forming a small, cozy mountain of laziness with her furry companions, a good book in one hand and a cup of coffee in the other—because, for Teresa, coffee is not just a beverage; it's a lifestyle choice that mirrors her passion for her job as a veterinary technician.

Rhyen was born and raised here in Arizona. He started at AAWC in December of 2021 as an Animal Care Assistant, moving up to Lead position within a few years. Rhyen is now moving on to veterinary technician to continue challenging himself, with a special interest in surgery.

He is currently attending CGCC and plans to transfer to ASU and obtain a degree in engineering. His mom has been a Veterinary Technician for most of his life, so he grew up volunteering in the veterinary field developing an appreciation for helping animals. He is fortunate enough to now be working with his amazing mom, Michelle, and brother, Nikolas, here at AAWC.

Most of his free time is spent with his family as well as catching up on sleep. Rhyen has a dog named Molly who likes to sass talk 24/7, a golden retriever named Levi Ryder and two cats, one named Sunny who loves to bite his ankles and another named Mizu, who doesn't have an off button. He enjoys being outdoors, taking road trips, and doing various arts and crafts.

Rhyen is a Fear Free Certified Professional.

Bailey has been working at AAWC since December of 2021 and has loved every minute of it. She has always dreamed of working with animals since she was a little girl and hopes she can become a technician one day. She can’t wait to learn more and grow at AAWC. In her spare time, she loves to paint, hang out with my friends, family and my dogs and go on trips to the beach.

Bailey is a Fear Free Certified Professional.

Caydence started her journey at Arizona Animal Wellness Center in 2021. Before she even had a chance to work at AAWC, she had always followed her mom's footsteps and wanted to involve herself with animals. Her mom, Natalie, has been working at AAWC since 2014 so she has grown up with the hospital and has seen it grow and flourish. Caydence currently attends EVIT for veterinary assistance to hopefully get a kickstart on her college career and learn more about programs in the veterinary field like rehab and prosthetics. She has been accepted to NAU after graduation. In her downtime, she loves playing soccer and being a goalkeeper for her school's soccer team. She also loves paddle boarding with her family and friends on the beautiful lakes and rivers of Arizona.

Caydence is a Fear Free Certified Professional.

Madisson, a passionate individual with a deep love for animals, found her way to Arizona Animal Wellness Center in 2022, fulfilling a childhood dream of working in a place she admired since growing up just across the street. In her role at AAWC, she serves as a vital member that supports our doctor and technician team.

For Madisson, the most fulfilling aspect of her job lies in providing essential support to ensure animals receive the care they need to lead happy and healthy lives. Her commitment to the well-being of animals extends beyond the walls of the hospital as evidenced by her impactful journey to Guatemala in the summer of 2023.

During her time in Guatemala, Madisson dedicated herself to a noble cause, participating in spaying and neutering programs for dogs and cats. Additionally, she played a crucial role in vaccinating farm animals, contributing to the overall health and welfare of the local animal population. This experience reflects Madissons’s compassionate nature and her determination to make a positive impact on animal welfare beyond her immediate community.

Beyond her work, Madisson enjoys exploring new places and embracing outdoor activities. Traveling holds a special place in her heart, and she particularly delights in the serene experience of paddleboarding. Madisson’s multifaceted interest and unwavering dedication to animal care make her a great asset to the AAWC team.

Madisson is a Fear Free Certified Professional.

Dylan entered the world of veterinary care in 2022 and has since been inspired by his dedicated coworkers, who have mentored and fueled his passion for animal well-being. Dylan is very passionate about contributing to our clinic's Fear Free initiative, aligning with his belief in fostering a calm and supportive environment for animals. His focus within the clinic is the rehab department, where he finds fulfillment in aiding animals on their journey to recovery. While his long-term career path in veterinary medicine is still taking shape, his ultimate goal remains constant — making a positive impact on the lives of animals. Beyond work, Dylan's home is a lively mix of cats and dogs, with his dog, George, being the real star of the show. In his free time, Dylan indulges in his love for cars by attending shows and participating in races.

Dylan is a Fear Free Certified Professional.

Abby was born in Albuquerque, New Mexico and was raised here in Arizona. She is attending ASU for a degree in Pre-Veterinary Medicine, and is working to become a Veterinarian. Through ASU she became involved in Vida, an organization that is working to bring human and animal care to less fortunate parts of Central America and is currently the Vida Ambassador for ASU. She has completed a mission trip to Costa Rica where she assisted in spays and neuters. Abby, her two cats, Rusty and Toby, and a pup named Finn, all live at home with her sister’s cat, Howl, and her Mom’s 3 other kitties and another pup, Murphy. In her spare time she enjoys all things outdoors; hiking, camping, lake time, biking, etc., with her friends and family.

Abby is a Fear Free Certified Professional.

Simone is originally from Portland, Oregon. She has lived in Brazil, Mexico, and Canada for many years. Before coming to work at AAWC, Simone worked on the family farm. She took care of goats, chickens, and dogs. She also did a service abroad trip to Costa Rica where she got her first clinical veterinary experience while exploring the beautiful country. Her favorite part of veterinary medicine is making a positive change in the lives of the animals and giving back the same amount of love and care that they give us. In her spare time she enjoys doing art such as clay and crochet. She also enjoys playing video games, reading, and spending time with her friends and family.

Simone is a Fear Free Certified Professional.

Meet Jenna, our dedicated team member with a heart for animals. Born on Christmas Eve, Jenna has a special connection with the magic of the holidays. Her passion for caring for creatures extends beyond the workplace, where she finds the greatest joy in witnessing animals recover and thrive.

Jenna’s personal “zoo” is a testament to her love for a variety of species. From the slithering elegance of her ball python to the charming personalities of her western hognoses, geckos of various species, and the ever-independent feline companion, her home is a haven for diverse and delightful companions.

When she’s not busy nurturing her animal family or tending to her responsibilities at work, Jenna loves to immerse herself in the beauty of the great outdoors. Hiking is her escape into nature, where she finds tranquility and inspiration. Pair that with her love for reading, and you have the perfect recipe for Jenna’s downtime.

Adding a touch of international flair to her story, Jenna had the incredible experience of being in France in 2018 when the nation celebrated its triumph in the soccer World Cup.

Jenna is a Fear Free Certified Professional.

Chaise was born and raised here in Arizona. She has always had a strong passion for learning about and caring for animals and other living creatures. As an important part of our animal care assistant team, she enjoys working with and learning about the surgery department the most. She has plans to attend MCC next year in hopes to further her veterinary medicine knowledge, but also has a strong love of art, and wants to pursue both passions. She incorporates art into the veterinary field by decorating some of our patients bandages to bring joy to their owners. Chaise has a jumping spider named Ginormca and a cat of her own named Kiki who was adopted from our clinic in January 2024. Outside of work she enjoys being outdoors, playing sports, hiking, working out, thrifting, cooking, playing guitar and cello, video games, and of course art.

Chaise is a Fear Free Certified Professional.

Nikolas embarked on his journey with AAWC in 2023, delving into his passion for animal care and the veterinary world. Recently, adding a third kitty, Sir Remington Rhodes, to his feline companions, Kisses and Dominos. Nikolas also has a corn snake named Valentine. Outside of his veterinary endeavors, Nikolas enjoys diving into the virtual worlds of video games, exploring new destinations through travel, and indulging in the occasional sake or wine tasting adventure. As he continues to explore and immerse himself in the world of animal welfare, Nikolas is dedicated to making a positive impact in the lives of animals and their owners.

Nikolas is a Fear Free Certified Professional.

Rozlyn was born in Illinois and moved to Arizona as a baby. Rozlyn is actually a 3rd generation AAWC employee as both of her Grandparents, as well as her mother, have also worked with us. Growing up around other staff members at AAWC, she developed a deep connection to the work environment. Rozlyn joined the team in 2024 and found the most fulfilling aspect of her job to be working with the animals and constantly learning new methods of caring for them.

Outside of work, Rozlyn spends quality time with her close friends and little sister. She also enjoys painting, going on long drives, and exploring inspiration on Pinterest. Her two cats, Deku and Yusai, add joy to her life beyond the workplace.

Rozlyn is a Fear Free Certified Professional.

Born and raised in San Tan Valley, Arizona, Siennah, aka "Sisi", grew up surrounded by animals, many of whom were not properly cared for. Motivated by a desire to improve the lives of animals and educate others about proper care, she pursued a career in animal welfare. Sisi attended EVIT high school, completing the Veterinarian Assistant Course in 2020. Two years of dedicated study at EVIT solidified her passion for animal care. Aspiring to become a technician, she is thrilled to be part of the AAWC family.

Outside of work, Sisi enjoys spending time with her six-year-old albino ball python, Mikasa. A talented artist and softball player since the age of thirteen, she dreams of someday possibly becoming a softball coach.

Taylor was born and raised in Arizona. He has always enjoyed working with his hands and has an immense love for animals . After 7 years of working in the agriculture/maintenance field, his skills lead him to AAWC in 2023. Since starting his time here, his love for animals and being able to help them has only grown.

Taylor lives with his wife and two dogs, Kona and Nala. In his spare time he loves spending time with his family and being outdoors. He is looking forward to his continued journey in this field and the positive impact he can have on the lives of animals.

Taylor is a Fear Free Certified Professional.
